Text.Text: Huh...  wha...  no!  No more torturing, I beg you!  Just kill me and be done with it!
Free?  Free you say?  I have failed in my mission - I shall never know freedom.  But tell me, who is it that so boldly attempts to free the prisoners of Severed Hand?
I am Toral Sorn, high cleric of the blessed Church of Ilmater.  Well met, <CHARNAME>.  I must say your quest is most bold and risky.
Thank you, but no.  My suffering brings me closer to Ilmater.  It is all that I have left...  and all that I can currently do to show my devotion to His glory.
A fair enough question, though painful to recollect.  Several months ago, our church received word that the Severed Hand was being taken over by a new kingdom, the Legion of Chimera.

At first we thought nothing of it - a new kingdom breathing life into the tomb-like Severed Hand could be a glorious thing.  That is until we realized who the new occupants were and the atrocities they were carrying out.

Slavery, torture, forceful inter-species breeding, and, worst of all, the worship of Iyachtu Xvim, the Lord of Darkness.  Bringing that hateful essence into this once holy elven fortress was, and still is, unthinkable.
It wasn't until I learned that Madae - once a child of Ilmater, eager to learn his ways - had fallen from his grace and embraced the evil that is Iyachtu Xvim, that I volunteered to come here.
I would not lie to you, <CHARNAME>, especially with something so serious.

I volunteered to come here and persuade Madae to come back to the suffering and loving embrace of Ilmater.  At the same time, I would sanctify anything that had been perverted by Iyachtu's unholy presence.  I insisted that I venture alone, just in case I failed in my mission - which I had so horribly...
For me, yes.  I am far too weak, even if I were to be healed, to carry out my mission.  I even fear that Madae is too lost to ever find her way back to Ilmater.  However...

I do believe that you have the resolve and fortitude to carry out the second part of my mission.  It would require you to carry out a specific ritual that could weaken the grip that Isair and Madae have on Severed Hand.  Are you interested?

Ilmater be praised!  Now listen carefully; you will need to perform the Blessed Ilmater Sanctification Ritual in front of the Ilmater statue in the Cleric's Tower.  This ritual, when performed correctly, will turn the vile, acidic waters that currently flow throughout the Severed Hand, back into elven holy water.

The waters of the Severed Hand act in a similar way as the blood in your veins - once purified, the Severed Hand should start to reject the changes that Isair and Madae have forced upon it, thus weakening some of their powers.

You will need four things: The first is the Tome of Ilmater.  I no longer have mine, but I have knowledge of a library that is still maintained in the mage tower.   With Ilmater's blessing, it may have a copy.  This tome will have the words that must be said to perform the ritual.
Next, you must find an Ilmater holy symbol.  That may prove difficult, but perhaps Madae still has her Ilmater holy symbol somewhere within Severed Hand.
You will need to find my Bonds of Suffering.  I believe they were torn from my body during one of my many torture sessions.

The final item you will need to complete the ritual is, quite literally, the tears of the suffering.  Considering how many tortured slaves there are in this fortress, it should not be too difficult a task to find some.

You will need to place the tears of suffering, my Ilmater bonds, and Madae's Ilmater holy symbol at the feet of the Ilmater statue.  Once placed, you will need to recite the words of the Ilmater Sanctification ritual from the Tome of Ilmater.

If all goes well, the waters will change and you will see a noticeable change in your surroundings.  In fact, the changed waters will have two effects; one is that the protective energy surrounding the Globe of Essence - a device that maintains the glabrezu guards' immortality - will fall and allow you to destroy the globe.  Destroying the globe will allow you to permanently defeat the glabrezu guards.

There is a radiant pool within the Severed Hand that I understand Isair and Madae have been drawing power.  I know their evil has negatively affected it.  If you would, take some of the holy water from the sanctified waters and pour it into the radiant pool.
In theory, once purified with the holy water, Isair and Madae would no longer be able to draw upon its power.  It could even right all the wrongs that Isair and Madae have caused within these walls.
Yes.  After you have completed the ritual, please come back and tell me - I wish to reaffirm that my suffering was not in vain.  May the blessings of Ilmater guide you in your quests.
I appreciate your concern, but I shall remain here until you have completed your tasks.  My suffering will act as solace during my prayers for your quick completion of your mission.
Ah, <CHARNAME>, have you completed the ritual?
You have done a wondrous thing.  Ilmater sheds tears of joy and gratitude for your selfless act.  I thank you.  Please speak to me again once you have purified the radiant pool.
We speak once again, <CHARNAME>.  What may I do for you?

Once again, you have brought tears of thanks from Ilmater and myself.  There is nothing more that I shall ask of you, except to leave me here in my glorious suffering so I may witness the Severed Hand's transformation to righteousness.
Who...  who is there...  what do you want?
Ah, <CHARNAME>, have you completed the ritual?
You're back, I see.  Have you come to a decision?
You have returned.  Did you pour the holy water on the mythal?

Certainly.  You will need to perform the Blessed Ilmater Sanctification Ritual in front of the Ilmater statue in the Cleric's Tower.  This ritual, when performed correctly, will turn the vile, acidic waters that currently flow throughout the Severed Hand, back into elven holy water.

The waters of the Severed Hand act in a similar way as the blood in your veins - once purified, the Severed Hand should start to reject the changes that Isair and Madae have forced upon it, thus weakening some of their powers.

You will need four things: The first is the Tome of Ilmater.  I no longer have mine, but I have knowledge of a library that is still maintained in the mage tower.   With Ilmater's blessing, it may have a copy.  This tome will have the words that must be said to perform the ritual.
Next, you must find an Ilmater holy symbol.  That may prove difficult, but perhaps Madae still has her Ilmater holy symbol somewhere within Severed Hand.
You will need to find my Bonds of Suffering.  I believe they were torn from my body during one of my many torture sessions.

The final item you will need to complete the ritual is, quite literally, the tears of the suffering.  Considering how many tortured slaves there are in this fortress, it should not be too difficult a task to find some.

You will need to place the tears of suffering, my Ilmater bonds, and Madae's Ilmater holy symbol at the feet of the Ilmater statue.  Once placed, you will need to recite the words of the Ilmater Sanctification ritual from the Tome of Ilmater.

If all goes well, the waters will change and you will see a noticeable change in your surroundings.  In fact, the changed waters will have two effects; one is that the protective energy surrounding the Globe of Essence - a device that maintains the glabrezu guards' immortality - will fall and allow you to destroy the globe.  Destroying the globe will allow you to permanently defeat the glabrezu guards.

There is a mythal within the Severed Hand that I understand Isair and Madae have been drawing power.  I know their evil has negatively affected it.  If you would, take some of the holy water from the sanctified waters and pour it into the radiant pool.
In theory, once purified with the holy water, Isair and Madae would no longer be able to draw upon its power.  It could even right all the wrongs that Isair and Madae have caused within these walls.
Yes.  After you have completed the ritual, please come back and tell me - I wish to reaffirm that my suffering was not in vain.  May the blessings of Ilmater guide you in your quests.
Ilmater and I shed tears of thanks for your gratious acts.  Farewell, <CHARNAME>.
This *Riki* you speak of is correct; I am Toral Sorn, high cleric of the blessed Church of Ilmater.  Well met, <CHARNAME>.  I must say your quest is most bold and risky.

My suffering brings me closer to Ilmater; it is an honor that I suffer so others may find hope.  But you...  you are a Dreadmaster!  What do you know of hope!  You bring tyranny - it is because of your god's bastard son that this evil has fallen upon the Severed Hand!
I will reveal nothing of what I know to the Black Hand!  I will not be the instrument that brings the Severed Hand closer to Bane and his unholy spawn, Iyachtu Xvim!

You... you are not the half-orc torturer... you are new.  I do not recognize you...  your clothes, they are that of a cleric, I see, but...  but I'm having trouble focusing.  Tell me, who are you and who among the gods has your faith?

It would seem that your studies in the dogma of Mask have failed you, Demarch!  I will not be fooled by you and reveal what I know.  It is common knowledge that Mask and Bane often ally to further their unscrupulous causes, and it is logical to assume that Mask would be eager to ally with Bane's bastard son, Iyachtu Xvim.  No, I will take what I know to the afterlife - for the glory of Ilmater!

A fair enough question, though painful to recollect.  My name is Toral Sorn.  Several months ago, our church received word that the Severed Hand was being taken over by a new kingdom, the Legion of Chimera.
NEVER!  Be gone from my sight, Stormlord!  Your chaotic dogma of destruction is not even welcome in this evil shrine to Iyachtu Xvim!

Glory be to Ilmater!  I thank you, fellow Painbearer, but I am not free - not since I have failed in my mission.  I shall never know freedom.  But tell me, who is it that so boldly attempts to free the prisoners of Severed Hand?
Hold, friend, I am not here to torture you.  I have set you free.
A priest of Ilmater I see.  Are you not finding pleasure in your suffering?
A priest of Ilmater I see.  Be calm, *friend,* I am here to help you, not torture you.
A priest of Ilmater I see.  Give yourself to the Destroyer, and I shall let you live.
Brother Painbearer, I am not here to torture you, I have set you free.
You're obviously delirious. Perhaps I'll return when you're more coherent.
What a shameful display of weakness!  I will let you rot where you are.
I am <CHARNAME>.  I have come to Severed Hand to eradicate Isair and Madae and their vile kingdom.  And you are?

My name is <CHARNAME>.  I have come to Severed Hand to eradicate Isair and Madae and their vile kingdom.  A Drow, named Riki, informed me that a priest of Ilmater was being held here.  Would that be you?
Yes, but one that must be carried out.  I see that you're injured.  May I assist you with healing?
I understand.  However, I am curious as to why a cleric of Ilmater would be in this abyssal den.
What did you hear?
This is all very interesting, but I am more interested in what was your mission.
On second thought, I'll get back to you.
I've seen the atrocities you mention first hand.  Please, continue.
I find that hard to believe that Madae was once a priest of Ilmater.
Please go on.
I find this hard to stomach.  I must take my leave for now.
Is it too late to finish your mission?
Yes, you have failed horribly, Toral.  I will leave you to suffer in your thoughts.
Yes, tell me about the ritual.
I'll have to think about it.  I'll get back to you.
I'm listening.
How do I perform this ritual?
What are the other items needed?
I will search for it.  What's next?
And the last item?
What will I need to do once I have all these items?
And what is the other effect?
What will that accomplish?
Is that everything I need to know?
Thank you, Toral.  However, you should probably leave this cell, rather than wait, and try to escape before the fighting starts.  It won't be safe.
Very well.  I shall return when my tasks are completed, Toral.
Yes, I have.  The waters are purified, and the Ilmater statue has been restored to its original glory.
I have purified the radiant pool with the elven holy water.
Very well, Toral, I shall respect your wish.  Good luck to you.
I am <CHARNAME>.  I am here to destroy the Legion of the Chimera.  Now tell me your name and why you are here.
No one but us shadows.
Please explain to me again what I need to do for the Ilmater Sanctification Ritual?
No, I haven't.  I will return when I have.
Yes, I have.  I will complete your mission for you.
I just don't know.  I need more time.
Not yet.  I will return when I have.
I'm listening.
How do I perform this ritual?
What are the other items needed?
I will search for it.  What's next?
Never mind, Toral, I remember now.
And the last item?
What will I need to do once I have all these items?
And what is the other effect?
What will that accomplish?
Is that everything I need to know?
Thank you, Toral.  I will return when the ritual is complete.
Yes, but one that must be carried out.  I see that you're injured.  May I assist you with healing?
Your lecture bores me.  Tell me why you're here, *Painbearer.*
You're obviously the priest Riki told me about.  Tell me what you know and why you're here, *Painbearer.*
I've heard enough.  Die, Painbearer.
So be it. Then you will die.
My faith?  Uh... that's not important right now, *friend.*  I just need you to tell me about the Severed Hand.
My faith?  Never mind that.  A recent acquaintance of mine informed me that you have some useful information about the Severed Hand.  Won't you share it with a fellow cleric?
My name is <CHARNAME>.  We may discuss my faith at a later time.  Currently, I need to know who you are and why you're here.

My name is <CHARNAME>.  We may discuss my faith at a later time.  However, I was told that you have information that may help me thwart Isair and Madae's grasp on the Severed Hand.  Please, tell me who you are, and what you know.
I've heard enough.  Die, Painbearer.
So be it. Then you will die.
Talos!
I am <CHARNAME>.  I have come to Severed Hand to eradicate Isair and Madae and their vile kingdom.  And you are?

My name is <CHARNAME>.  I have come to Severed Hand to eradicate Isair and Madae and their vile kingdom.  A drow, named Riki, informed me that a priest of Ilmater was being held here.  Tell me, what is your name?
